info.description: Complete API collection for testing PDE Service Edge Functions locally

request.description:
Creates super admin role. Uses Supabase REST API with service role key to bypass RLS.

**Requires**: {{serviceRoleKey}} - Get from `supabase status`

**Auto-sets**: {{superAdminRoleId}} from response

**Note**: If role already exists (409), automatically fetches existing role ID.

Creates admin employee. Requires level 2+ auth.

**Prerequisites**:
- Super admin role must exist (run Step 1 or seed.sql)
- Set {{superAdminRoleId}} variable from Step 1 response
- Set {{adminEmail}} in environment

header.description: Use service role key for admin operations

request.description:
Creates auth user via Supabase Admin API.

**Requires**: Service role key ({{serviceRoleKey}})

**Sets**: {{adminAuthUserId}} from response

Links the auth user to the employee record.

**Prerequisites**:
- Admin employee created (Step 2)
- Auth user created (Step 3)
- {{adminEmployeeId}} and {{adminAuthUserId}} set

**Note**: This endpoint creates the auth user if it doesn't exist, or links existing one.

Links an existing auth user to employee.

Use this if you already created the auth user manually or via Supabase Dashboard.

Verifies the admin user was created and linked correctly.

Should return employee with:
- code: ADMIN001
- auth_user_id: set (not null)
- role_id: pointing to SUPER_ADMIN role
- role level: 10

item.description:
Complete setup flow to create a super admin user.

**Recommended Approach**:
1. Run `supabase/seed.sql` first (creates role + employee)
2. Use Step 3 to create auth user
3. Use Step 4 to link auth to employee

**Alternative (API-only)**:
1. Step 1: Create role (requires service role key)
2. Step 2: Create employee (requires level 2+ auth)
3. Step 3: Create auth user
4. Step 4: Link auth to employee

exec: console.log('âœ… Access token saved to environment!');

request.description:
Returns current authenticated user's information:

**Returns:**
- Full employee data with all fields (id, name, code, email, nickname, role_id, auth_user_id, is_active, etc.)
- `role_data`: Complete role information including:
  - Role details (id, code, name_th, name_en, description, level, is_active, requires_auth)
  - `department`: Nested department information (id, code, name_th, name_en, description, is_active)

**Use Case:**
Get the current user's profile, role, and department information for UI display and permission checks.

**Requires:** Authentication (Bearer token)

Returns enabled features for the current authenticated user:

**Returns:**
- Array of feature objects with:
  - `id`: Feature ID (UUID)
  - `code`: Feature code (unique identifier)
  - `name_th`: Feature name in Thai
  - `name_en`: Feature name in English
  - `is_menu_item`: Whether this feature should appear in the menu
  - `is_active`: Whether this feature is active
  - `allowed_roles`: Array of role codes allowed to access this feature (null if no restriction)

**Filtering:**
Features are automatically filtered based on:
- `is_active = true` (only active features)
- Employee's level (`min_level <= employee.level`)
- Employee's role (if `allowed_roles` is specified)

**Note:** `min_level` is not returned in the response for security reasons.

**Use Case:**
Get enabled features for UI rendering, feature flags, and menu generation.

**Requires:** Authentication (Bearer token)

Network search employees - Network user search API for employee management. Supports text search (name, email) and network-relevant filters (department, role, active status). Supports pagination. Requires level 0+.
Get employee summary with minimal fields (id, name, email, role_name, is_link_auth). Only active employees. No pagination. Requires level 0+.

query.description: Start time (HH:MM:SS format, optional, must be provided with time_end)
End time (HH:MM:SS format, optional, must be provided with time_start)

request.description: Get technicians from 'technical' department with availability status for a given date/time. Returns minimal fields (id, name, availability). If only date is provided, any appointment on that date = unavailable. If time is provided, checks for time range overlap. Requires level 1+.
Get a single employee by ID. Requires level 0+.
Create a new employee. Requires level 2+.
Update an employee. Requires level 2+.
Link auth account to employee. Creates auth user if it doesn't exist, or links existing one. Requires level 2+.
Link an existing auth user to employee. Use this if you already created the auth user manually or via Supabase Dashboard. Requires level 2+.
Unlink auth account from employee. Requires level 2+.
Delete an employee. Requires level 3+.

query.description: Start date for filtering by appointment date (YYYY-MM-DD). Must be used with end_date.
End date for filtering by appointment date (YYYY-MM-DD). Must be used with start_date.
Exclude tickets with null appointment_id (backlog tickets)
Filter by department ID(s). Single value or percent-separated multiple values (e.g., 'uuid1%uuid2%uuid3'). Filters tickets with employees from the specified department(s).

request.description:
Search tickets with filters on all ticket fields. Supports pagination. All query parameters are optional.

**New Parameters:**
- `start_date` & `end_date`: Filter by appointment date range (YYYY-MM-DD). When used together, automatically excludes tickets with null appointment dates.
- `exclude_backlog`: Set to `true` to exclude tickets with null appointment_id (backlog tickets)
- `department_id`: Filter by department ID(s). Supports single value or percent-separated multiple values (e.g., 'uuid1%uuid2%uuid3'). Filters tickets that have employees assigned from the specified department(s). Filters through: departments â†’ roles â†’ employees â†’ ticket_employees â†’ tickets.

**Response includes:**
- `appointment_id`: Appointment ID (UUID)
- `appointment_date`: Appointment date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `appointment_time_start`: Appointment start time (HH:MM:SS)
- `appointment_time_end`: Appointment end time (HH:MM:SS)
- `appointment_type`: Appointment type (e.g., "time_range", "all_day", etc.)
- `created_by`: Creator employee ID (UUID, automatically set by backend)
- `creator_name`: Creator display name
- `creator_code`: Creator employee code

Search tickets by date range with selectable date type (create, update, or appointed). Requires startDate and endDate.

**Response includes:**
- `appointment_id`: Appointment ID (UUID)
- `appointment_date`: Appointment date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `appointment_time_start`: Appointment start time (HH:MM:SS)
- `appointment_time_end`: Appointment end time (HH:MM:SS)
- `appointment_type`: Appointment type (e.g., "time_range", "all_day", etc.)

request.description: Create a ticket with all related data (company, site, contact, appointment, employees, merchandise) in one API call. If company tax_id exists, use it; otherwise create new. If site/contact id provided, use it; otherwise create new. Requires level 1+.

Update ticket with all related data. Company/Site/Contact cannot be updated after creation - use existing by ID or create new. employee_ids and merchandise_ids replace all existing associations. Omit fields to keep existing associations. Requires level 1+.
Delete a ticket and optionally related data (appointment, contact). All related data (employees, merchandise, work results) are automatically cleaned up. Requires level 1+.

Remove a specific employee assignment from a ticket. The assignment is uniquely identified by the combination of ticket_id, employee_id, and date. This allows de-assigning employees from tickets without deleting the entire ticket. Requires level 2+.

**Request Body Fields:**
- `ticket_id` (required): UUID of the ticket
- `employee_id` (required): UUID of the employee to remove
- `date` (required): Date of the assignment (YYYY-MM-DD format)

**Notes:**
- The assignment is uniquely identified by the combination of date, employee_id, and ticket_id
- Only level 2+ employees can remove assignments
Global search companies by name or tax ID with pagination. Returns paginated results.
Get up to 5 company hints. If query is empty, returns 5 most recent companies. If query is provided, searches and returns matching companies.
Get a single company by ID (tax_id). Note: The ID parameter is the company's tax_id.

Create a new company or update an existing one if found by tax_id. If company exists, it will be updated. If not found, a new company will be created. Main branch site is automatically managed. Requires level 1+.
Create a new company. Requires level 1+.
Update a company. The ID parameter is the company's tax_id. Main branch site is automatically updated. Requires level 1+.
Delete a company. The ID parameter is the company's tax_id. Requires level 1+.
Global search sites by name or address with pagination. Returns paginated results with summary fields only (id, name, description, company_id).
Get up to 5 site hints. If query is empty, returns 5 sites ordered by name. If query is provided, searches and returns matching sites.
Get a single site by ID. Returns full site details including company information.
Create a new site. safety_standard is optional array of safety requirements.
Update an existing site. All fields are optional. To clear safety_standard, send null or empty array []. Requires level 1+.
Delete a site. Requires level 1+.
Search contacts by name, phone, or email
Get all contacts for a specific site
Get a single contact by UUID
Create a new contact. Requires level 1+.
Update a contact. Requires level 2+.
Delete a contact. Requires level 2+.
Search departments by code or name with pagination. Requires level 0+.
Get department summary with employee counts (total, active, inactive). Requires level 0+.
Get a single department by ID. Requires level 0+.
Create a new department. Requires level 3+ (Superadmin only).
Update a department. Requires level 3+ (Superadmin only).
Delete a department. Requires level 3+ (Superadmin only).
Search roles by code or name with pagination. Requires level 0+.
Get role summary with employee counts (total, active, inactive). Requires level 0+.
Create a new role. Requires level 3+ (Superadmin only).
Update a role. Requires level 3+ (Superadmin only).
Delete a role. Requires level 3+ (Superadmin only).
Get all reference data constants (work types, statuses, leave types, provinces) in a single response
Get appointment for a specific ticket
Create a new appointment. Requires level 1+.
Update an appointment. Requires level 2+.
Delete an appointment. Requires level 2+.
Get work result for a specific ticket
Update a work result. Requires level 0+ (all authenticated users).
Upload a photo to a work result. Requires multipart/form-data with work_result_id and file. Requires level 1+.
Delete a photo from a work result. Requires level 1+.
Upload a document to a work result. Requires multipart/form-data with work_result_id and file. Requires level 1+.
Delete a document from a work result. Requires level 1+.
Add a page to a multi-page document. Requires multipart/form-data with document_id, file, and page_number. Requires level 1+.
Delete a page from a document. Requires level 1+.
Delete a work result. Requires level 0+ (all authenticated users).
Update a leave request. Can only update pending requests. Requires level 1+.
Approve a leave request. Requires level 2+.
Reject a leave request. Requires level 2+.
Cancel a leave request. Can only cancel pending requests. Requires level 1+.
Delete a leave request. Requires level 2+.
Vote on a poll. Requires level 0+.
Update a poll. Requires level 0+ (all authenticated users).
Delete a poll. Requires level 0+ (all authenticated users).

query.description: Search query for serial number (partial match, case-insensitive)

request.description: Search merchandise by serial number. If no query is provided, returns all merchandise (up to 20 items). Results are limited to 20 items, ordered by creation date (newest first).

query.description: Search query string. If empty, returns 5 most recent merchandise ordered by creation date.
Filter by site ID (UUID). If provided, only returns merchandise from the specified site.

request.description: Get up to 5 merchandise hints. If query is empty, returns 5 most recent merchandise. If query is provided, searches by serial number and returns matching merchandise. If site_id is provided, filters results by site.

query.description: Serial number to check for duplicates (required)

request.description: Check if a serial number already exists in the system. Useful for validating before creating new merchandise. Returns `is_duplicate: true` if found, along with the merchandise record. Returns `is_duplicate: false` and `merchandise: null` if not found. Requires level 0+ (all authenticated users).
Get a single merchandise item by its ID. Returns full merchandise details including model and site information.
Create a new merchandise item. Required fields: serial_no, model_id, site_id. Optional fields: pm_count, distributor_id, dealer_id, replaced_by_id. Requires level 1+.
Update an existing merchandise item. All fields are optional. Requires level 2+.
Delete a merchandise item. Cannot delete merchandise that has PM logs or is referenced elsewhere. Requires level 2+.

query.description: Search in model description/name (partial match, case-insensitive)
Search in model code (partial match, case-insensitive)

request.description: Search models by description and/or code. If no parameters are provided, returns all models (up to 20 items). If both parameters are provided, results will match either condition (OR logic). Results are limited to 20 items, ordered by creation date (newest first).
Create a new model. Required fields: model (unique model code). Optional fields: name, website_url. Requires level 1+.
